qas.question: How long was the time to maturity on an LTRO?
When were the first supplemental LTRO's offered?
How long had the time to maturity been previously?
How many bids were recorded at the auction for the first 12 month LRTO?

context: The ECB's first supplementary <a0_0><b5_0>longer-term refinancing operation<b5_0/><a0_0/> (LTRO) with a <a1_0><b6_0>six-month<b6_0/><a1_0/> maturity was announced <a2_0><b7_0>March 2008<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Previously the longest tender offered was <a3_0><b8_0>three months<b8_0/><a3_0/>. It announced two 3-month and one 6-month full allotment of Long Term Refinancing Operations (LTROs). The first tender was settled 3 April, and was more than four times oversubscribed. The €25 billion auction drew bids amounting to €103.1 billion, from 177 banks. Another six-month tender was allotted on 9 July, again to the amount of €25 billion. The first 12-month LTRO in June 2009 had <a4_0><b9_0>close to 1100 bidders<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
